com.azure.storage.blob

Class BlobServiceAsyncClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.azure.storage.blob.BlobServiceAsyncClient

  • public final class BlobServiceAsyncClient
extends java.lang.Object
    Client to a storage account. It may only be instantiated through a BlobServiceClientBuilder. This class does not hold any state about a particular storage account but is instead a convenient way of sending off appropriate requests to the resource on the service. It may also be used to construct URLs to blobs and containers.

    This client contains operations on a blob. Operations on a container are available on ContainerAsyncClient through BlobServiceAsyncClient.getContainerAsyncClient(String), and operations on a blob are available on BlobAsyncClient.

    Please see here for more information on containers.

    Note this client is an async client that returns reactive responses from Spring Reactor Core project (https://projectreactor.io/). Calling the methods in this client will NOT start the actual network operation, until .subscribe() is called on the reactive response. You can simply convert one of these responses to a CompletableFuture object through Mono.toFuture().

    • Method Detail

      • getContainerAsyncClient

        public ContainerAsyncClient getContainerAsyncClient(java.lang.String containerName)
        Initializes a ContainerAsyncClient object pointing to the specified container. This method does not create a container. It simply constructs the URL to the container and offers access to methods relevant to containers.
        Parameters:
        containerName - The name of the container to point to.
        Returns:
        A ContainerAsyncClient object pointing to the specified container

      • createContainer

        public reactor.core.publisher.Mono<Response<ContainerAsyncClient>> createContainer(java.lang.String containerName)
        Creates a new container within a storage account. If a container with the same name already exists, the operation fails. For more information, see the Azure Docs.
        Parameters:
        containerName - Name of the container to create
        Returns:
        A response containing a ContainerAsyncClient used to interact with the container created.

      • createContainer

        public reactor.core.publisher.Mono<Response<ContainerAsyncClient>> createContainer(java.lang.String containerName,
                                                                                   Metadata metadata,
                                                                                   PublicAccessType accessType)
        Creates a new container within a storage account. If a container with the same name already exists, the operation fails. For more information, see the Azure Docs.
        Parameters:
        containerName - Name of the container to create
        metadata - Metadata
        accessType - Specifies how the data in this container is available to the public. See the x-ms-blob-public-access header in the Azure Docs for more information. Pass null for no public access.
        Returns:
        A response containing a ContainerAsyncClient used to interact with the container created.

      • deleteContainer

        public reactor.core.publisher.Mono<VoidResponse> deleteContainer(java.lang.String containerName)
        Deletes the specified container in the storage account. If the container doesn't exist the operation fails. For more information see the Azure Docs.
        Parameters:
        containerName - Name of the container to delete
        Returns:
        A response containing status code and HTTP headers

        Gets the URL of the storage account represented by this client.
        Returns:
        the URL.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - If the account URL is malformed.

      • listContainers

        public reactor.core.publisher.Flux<ContainerItem> listContainers()
        Returns a reactive Publisher emitting all the containers in this account lazily as needed. For more information, see the Azure Docs.
        Returns:
        A reactive response emitting the list of containers.

      • listContainers

        public reactor.core.publisher.Flux<ContainerItem> listContainers(ListContainersOptions options)
        Returns a reactive Publisher emitting all the containers in this account lazily as needed. For more information, see the Azure Docs.
        Parameters:
        options - A ListContainersOptions which specifies what data should be returned by the service.
        Returns:
        A reactive response emitting the list of containers.

      • getProperties

        public reactor.core.publisher.Mono<Response<StorageServiceProperties>> getProperties()
        Gets the properties of a storage account’s Blob service. For more information, see the Azure Docs.
        Returns:
        A reactive response containing the storage account properties.

      • setProperties

        public reactor.core.publisher.Mono<VoidResponse> setProperties(StorageServiceProperties properties)
        Sets properties for a storage account's Blob service endpoint. For more information, see the Azure Docs. Note that setting the default service version has no effect when using this client because this client explicitly sets the version header on each request, overriding the default.
        Parameters:
        properties - Configures the service.
        Returns:
        A reactive response containing the storage account properties.

      • getUserDelegationKey

        public reactor.core.publisher.Mono<Response<UserDelegationKey>> getUserDelegationKey(java.time.OffsetDateTime start,
                                                                                     java.time.OffsetDateTime expiry)
        Gets a user delegation key for use with this account's blob storage. Note: This method call is only valid when using TokenCredential in this object's HttpPipeline.
        Parameters:
        start - Start time for the key's validity. Null indicates immediate start.
        expiry - Expiration of the key's validity.
        Returns:
        A reactive response containing the user delegation key.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If start isn't null and is after expiry.

      • getStatistics

        public reactor.core.publisher.Mono<Response<StorageServiceStats>> getStatistics()
        Retrieves statistics related to replication for the Blob service. It is only available on the secondary location endpoint when read-access geo-redundant replication is enabled for the storage account. For more information, see the Azure Docs.
        Returns:
        A reactive response containing the storage account statistics.

      • getAccountInfo

        public reactor.core.publisher.Mono<Response<StorageAccountInfo>> getAccountInfo()
        Returns the sku name and account kind for the account. For more information, please see the Azure Docs.
        Returns:
        A reactive response containing the storage account info.

      • generateAccountSAS

        public java.lang.String generateAccountSAS(AccountSASService accountSASService,
                                           AccountSASResourceType accountSASResourceType,
                                           AccountSASPermission accountSASPermission,
                                           java.time.OffsetDateTime expiryTime)
        Generates an account SAS token with the specified parameters
        Parameters:

        accountSASResourceType - An optional AccountSASResourceType resources for the account SAS
        accountSASPermission - The AccountSASPermission permission for the account SAS
        expiryTime - The OffsetDateTime expiry time for the account SAS
        Returns:
        A string that represents the SAS token

        public java.lang.String generateAccountSAS(AccountSASService accountSASService,
                                           AccountSASResourceType accountSASResourceType,
                                           AccountSASPermission accountSASPermission,
                                           java.time.OffsetDateTime expiryTime,
                                           java.time.OffsetDateTime startTime,
                                           java.lang.String version,

                                           SASProtocol sasProtocol)
        Generates an account SAS token with the specified parameters
        Parameters:
        accountSASService - The AccountSASService services for the account SAS
        accountSASResourceType - An optional AccountSASResourceType resources for the account SAS
        accountSASPermission - The AccountSASPermission permission for the account SAS
        expiryTime - The OffsetDateTime expiry time for the account SAS
        startTime - The OffsetDateTime start time for the account SAS
        version - The String version for the account SAS
        ipRange - An optional IPRange ip address range for the SAS
        sasProtocol - An optional SASProtocol protocol for the SAS
        Returns:
        A string that represents the SAS token
